reviews.text: We booked 2 rooms for 1 night as we were traveling through, and we were very happy with our choice of hotel. Very clean and comfortable. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom even included makeup removal cloths, which I had forgotten mine. Breakfast was good, waffles, english muffins, toast, bagels, sausage patties, eggs, boiled eggs, assorted cereals, etc. This hotel seems to be pretty new and it is very clean. No complains, we would stay here again. We spent less than $100 for each room.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Very Clean

reviews.text: The building was beautiful - brand new. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom and all amenities were nice. Continental breakfast was average with a waffle maker and a friendly attendant.
reviews.title: Turning night into day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem was that a flood light was pointed directly at the window of our first floor room. My wife fell asleep as soon as we got in, so rather than disturbing my wife, I tried to fall alseep, too. Finally, about midnight I gave up. The room felt like it was morning. I woke up my wife and asked if she would mind changing rooms, and she said, "Why worry? It's already dawn." Then she looked at the clock.
reviews.title: okay but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thankfully, the man at the front desk graciously reassigned us to a room on the 3rd floor. I fell asleep as soon as I hit the bed. The next morning at checkout I asked the manager if she had received other complaints about room 103. She said, "Yes, we have received several. Maybe we should do something about that." Unfortunately for them, they had two rooms to clean for the price of one, and we had to pack up and switch rooms at midnight.
